description: 共同科英文（一）課程為一學年課程，每學期兩學分，係為非英語系學生所開設的課程。目標在幫助大一學生活用中學時期所累積的英語知識，提昇英語聽、說、讀、寫整體的溝通能力。為達此目標，本課程要求教師盡量用英語上課，努力營造一個豐富的英語環境，讓學生不但有充分機會以英語參與課堂活動，且樂於使用英語與同學及老師溝通。
goals: 增進學生英語溝通表達能力
透過參與課程活動促進團隊精神
透過多面向英語閱讀促使學生了解多元文化，拓展學生國際化視野
透過課堂討論培養批判精神
提升學生英語學習動機及自主學習興趣

Keynote 4 (Available at 師大書苑)

Online resource: [http://ame.eltkeynote.com/student-book-audio/student-book-4](http://ame.eltkeynote.com/student-book-audio/student-book-4)

**Course Description and Objectives:**

This general English course is designed to enhance students’ reading, writing, listening and speaking skills. Students will be offered the opportunity to develop these four language skills along with critical thinking skills by presenting them with ideas from all over the world.

**Requirements & Grading policy:**

*   **Attendance and Participation  20%**

\# Punctual attendance and active participation are required. Participation also includes teamwork and group projects.

\# If you are habitually late or absent, points will be deducted and you may fail this course.

\# Exceptions are allowed only under emergent circumstances or notification in advance. Please inform the instructor in advance through **EMAIL** if you will not be able to attend the class.

*   **Show and Tell (Midterm)  30%**

\# Select three pictures and prepare a 2-minute talk discussing the pictures. Note that the three pictures should be related or share a common theme.

\# Remember to turn in your script (hard copy)

*   **Book Talk (Final)  30%**

\# Make a poster:

Option 1. Make an ID card which belongs to one of the characters in your selected book. The ID should include a picture and all information found on a real ID card.

Option 2. Make a map showing where the story took place.

\# Prepare a 2-minute presentation to present either the ID or the map.

*   **Unit Reports\*2  10%**

In your unit report, you should include…

1.  a 100-word reflection about the reading material
2.  a 10-word vocabulary/phrase list including each vocabulary’s/phrase’s Chinese meaning, part-of-speech, and an example sentence.

Please turn in your reports through Moodle on time. Late reports or printed reports will not be accepted.

*   **Lexile Test  10%**
